question: How does the person pass the second palm branch?
options: The person loosely curls the fingers of their right hand around the second palm branch and allows it to fall onto the ground without using their left hand.
The person holds the second palm branch with both hands and then moves it over their shoulder without passing it to their left hand.
The person pinches the second palm branch between their thumb and index finger and moves it away slightly without transferring it to their left hand.
The person grabs the second palm branch with their left hand and lowers it onto the ground instead of gently onto the right side.

The person firmly curls the fingers of their right hand around the second palm branch, passes it to their left hand, which grasps it securely, gathers all the branches together with both hands, and lowers them gently onto the right side of the ground.
